ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Deeper appreciation / skills in Spanish language
I learned about the fundamental aspects of how to create, speak, and read a Spanish sentence. This is a course to build your knowledge and really take your skills in Spanish to the next level.

My Spanish speaking and writing skills improved tremendously, and I feel like I was able to truly conceptualize putting together sentences and statements rather than just memorizing vocabulary and conjugations.
I was able to learn how to speak at an intermediate level along with countless vocabulary words and a better appreciation for the spanish language and how it works.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: ABSOLUTELY LOVED THE TEACHER!!!!! SEORA RUBIO IS AMAZING!!!!! So sweet and generous also very funny, listened to student feedback, made the students want to work hard

The main strength of this course was the instructor. Lucia Rubio is a talented, smart, and passionate individual who knows how to get her class engaged. I wish I could have her as my Spanish teacher for the rest of my time at Yale. I have never been more excited about attending a morning class. She is the epitome of what Yale should and strives to be.

The biggest strength of this course was our in-class "lectures" and discussions. The class format made it easier to break down Spanish concepts, and it facilitated good discussion and practice. The biggest weakness of the class was the speed at which we needed to learn new terms and vocabulary. While I understand that the course is designed to teach a lot in a short period, it is very easy to fall behind if you don't study every day.

The only weakness I can think of is the virtual day where I would often not do any of the work until much later in the evening. However, I felt that the seminar like environment of the class along with the professor made this class fantastic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES!! Especially with seora rubio. amazing class so fun + loved getting to know my classmates.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to continue learning Spanish. It was so vital to my learning. I will never forget this class.
Yes, I recommend this course for anyone looking to improve their conversational Spanish. There is a lot to learn, but in turn, I learned a lot.
Professor Rubio makes learning Spanish extremely engaging, hence I would definitely recommend this course!
Yes, I think that spanish is such an important language to learn and that learning another language in general should be a must.
